page.title: 02ECOLOGY
page.content: The{Brook Dyke}runs through Wath and is polluted_mainly with rubbish. All kinds of{rubbish}is thrown in,including fridges,broken bottles,springs and old mattresses.But inspite of the pollution things still live there.Here are found snails and worms pond skaters and water boatmen and surprisingly enough three spined sticklebacks.The source of this pollution is people who live near the dyke who can't be bothered to take their rubbish to the dumpit site where they can be disposed of properly,instead they throw it into the stream and pollute it.Children who play down near the dyke help to pollute it too by throwing their crisp bags and glass bottles in.Once Brook Dyke was a lovely clean unpolluted stream but now it is an eye sore and it will probably never recover.
